noun.description: A person who or thing which is ready or matures early.
An early-ripening variety of peach. Now historical.
US regional (New England). An early-ripening onion; a spring onion.

adjective.description: Especially of grains, fruit, or vegetables: coming early to maturity; ripening early in the year.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Zachary Bogan (1625–1659), classical and biblical scholar. From rare + ripe.
